fields._bio_rendered: Guan studies Human-Computer Interaction at UC San Diego. As the first person in his family goes to college, he has always been looking to contribute to the community and support education. He’s also passionate about understanding human behavior and the context around interactions with technology.
fields.bio: Guan studies Human-Computer Interaction at UC San Diego. As the first person in his family goes to college, he has always been looking to contribute to the community and support education. He’s also passionate about understanding human behavior and the context around interactions with technology.
fields.name: Guan Wang
fields.title: User Experience Lead

fields._bio_rendered: Jamie is a PhD Candidate in Cognitive Science at UC San Diego, and co-founder of several educational technology platforms, including thisCourse, ESL Genie, and KA Lite. He loves taking things apart and putting them back together again, eating delicious vegan food, and thinking about what an awesome world he lives in and how to make it even better. He has crawled through the tunnels of Knossos, but didn’t find the Minotaur.
fields.bio: Jamie is a PhD Candidate in Cognitive Science at UC San Diego, and co-founder of several educational technology platforms, including thisCourse, ESL Genie, and KA Lite. He loves taking things apart and putting them back together again, eating delicious vegan food, and thinking about what an awesome world he lives in and how to make it even better. He has crawled through the tunnels of Knossos, but didn’t find the Minotaur.
fields.name: Jamie Alexandre
fields.title: Software Architecture Lead

fields._bio_rendered: Ben: Hadzabe, Berkshires, Microsoft, UC San Diego, Lateralization, Bicycling, 東京, RedBubble, Family, Sunrise, Evolution, Homeless, Moonset, Calvin, Hobbes, 한글, corpus callosum. Now, Python, KA Lite, and the FLE.  I don’t really like computers, but I know how to use them to get stuff done! A small amount of work by us can make a big difference for others.  Good enough for me--let’s make it happen!
fields.bio: Ben: Hadzabe, Berkshires, Microsoft, UC San Diego, Lateralization, Bicycling, 東京, RedBubble, Family, Sunrise, Evolution, Homeless, Moonset, Calvin, Hobbes, 한글, corpus callosum. Now, Python, KA Lite, and the FLE.  I don’t really like computers, but I know how to use them to get stuff done! A small amount of work by us can make a big difference for others.  Good enough for me--let’s make it happen!
fields.name: Ben Cipollini
fields.title: Software Development Lead, Implementations Liason

fields._bio_rendered: Desiring to give everyone an opportunity to experience the joy of the world opening up to them, Bethany works to connect like-minded people to support the mission of education for all.  When she’s not attached to her computer, she enjoys traveling and making new friends along the way. Just suggest new music or books to her, and you’ll be friends for life.
fields.bio: Desiring to give everyone an opportunity to experience the joy of the world opening up to them, Bethany works to connect like-minded people to support the mission of education for all.  When she’s not attached to her computer, she enjoys traveling and making new friends along the way. Just suggest new music or books to her, and you’ll be friends for life.
fields.name: Bethany Eldridge
fields.title: Partnerships Lead

fields._bio_rendered:
When he isn't rocking out in his Prius, you can find Dylan doing a little bit of everything: drafting documents, massacring his email inbox with '}', chatting on the phone with our partners, or trying to sneak into quiet, dark places so that he can get back to coding.

He tries to smile and travel as much as he possibly can.
fields.bio:

He tries to smile and travel as much as he possibly can.
fields.name: Dylan Barth
fields.title: President

fields._bio_rendered: As a management student turned computer programmer, Aron is looking for opportunities in changing the world through technology. When not in front of the computer, you can usually find him daydreaming, reading a scifi novel, or chatting with a friend
fields.bio: As a management student turned computer programmer, Aron is looking for opportunities in changing the world through technology. When not in front of the computer, you can usually find him daydreaming, reading a scifi novel, or chatting with a friend
fields.name: Aron Asor
fields.title: Software Developer

fields._bio_rendered: Steve’s background is software development and technical support.   He works full-time in education, and is particularly interested in building students’ confidence with maths.  When not drinking tea, Steve is normally found testing the latest development code, particularly on the Raspberry Pi
fields.bio: Steve’s background is software development and technical support.   He works full-time in education, and is particularly interested in building students’ confidence with maths.  When not drinking tea, Steve is normally found testing the latest development code, particularly on the Raspberry Pi
fields.name: Steve Appleton
fields.title: Volunteer Software Developer

fields._bio_rendered: Kriti, who is currently taking a gap year before attending medical school, is deeply inspired by KA Lite’s vision. If she isn’t shouting out answers at the TV screen when Jeopardy is on, she is most probably experimenting in the kitchen, writing, or solving the daily newspaper’s cryptogram. Her favorite experiences in life include the take-off of a flight (in which a window seat is a must) and any discussion in immunology
fields.bio: Kriti, who is currently taking a gap year before attending medical school, is deeply inspired by KA Lite’s vision. If she isn’t shouting out answers at the TV screen when Jeopardy is on, she is most probably experimenting in the kitchen, writing, or solving the daily newspaper’s cryptogram. Her favorite experiences in life include the take-off of a flight (in which a window seat is a must) and any discussion in immunology
fields.name: Kriti Gupta
fields.title: Implementations Volunteer

fields._bio_rendered: Richard enjoys tea, trivia, and teaching. To distract himself from the stresses of juggling life as a PhD student, developing on KA Lite, and teaching, Richard can often be found literally juggling in his office. Richard thinks that learning is the key to unlocking human potential and allowing everyone to flourish, and that making learning fit the learner is the way to achieve this goal
fields.bio: Richard enjoys tea, trivia, and teaching. To distract himself from the stresses of juggling life as a PhD student, developing on KA Lite, and teaching, Richard can often be found literally juggling in his office. Richard thinks that learning is the key to unlocking human potential and allowing everyone to flourish, and that making learning fit the learner is the way to achieve this goal
fields.name: Richard Tibbles
fields.title: Learning Lead, Software Developer

fields._bio_rendered: Rui is a Computer Science student at the University of Porto (Portugal). He loves science and technology and through it, he wants to inspire societies to learn, and to dream big to make the world a better place. Through a complicated life background, Rui has learned the value of learning and how knowledge can change your life. Rui believes there is an amazing potential that is being wasted in the world and it is up to us, the ones who can and have access, to fix that by opening the doors to everyone who is willing to learn.
fields.bio: Rui is a Computer Science student at the University of Porto (Portugal). He loves science and technology and through it, he wants to inspire societies to learn, and to dream big to make the world a better place. fields.name: Rui Malheiro
fields.title: Software Developer

fields._bio_rendered: Part-time student, part-time employee, and full-time explorer, Alexsandra is constantly in pursuit of new life lessons and the perfect cup of coffee. She spends a lot of time meeting kindred spirits who care about educational opportunities and trying to tell the amazing story of FLE. If you think she’s someone you want to know, find her in the twitter-verse or through FLE’s facebook page

fields.name: Alexsandra McMahan
fields.title: Marketing Lead

fields._bio_rendered: Liz watches out for the Implementations team, which means she works with the inspiring KA Lite users from around the world who share the vision of equal learning opportunities for all.  She comes from a background in and has a love for marine science. Reality TV cooking shows and Ben & Jerry's otherwise earn her undying devotion.

fields.name: Elizabeth Vu
fields.title: Implementations Lead

fields._bio_rendered: Mr. Rowe has 41 years of experience as a business attorney. He has acted as general legal counsel for more than 100 businesses. He has extensive experience in purchase and sale of business transactions.
fields.bio: Mr. Rowe has 41 years of experience as a business attorney. He has acted as general legal counsel for more than 100 businesses. He has extensive experience in purchase and sale of business transactions.
fields.name: Charles E. Rowe
fields.title: Secretary, Board Member

fields._bio_rendered: Formerly a tax accountant at Deloitte, a financial litigator at Bingham McCutchen, and advertising policy strategist at Google, Catherine recently founded a legal analytics startup. She holds a J.D. from New York University School of Law, a B.B.A. and an M.P.A. in business and accounting from the University of Texas at Austin. Her certifications include New York State Bar admission, C.P.A. license and Certified Information Privacy Professional.
fields.bio: Formerly a tax accountant at Deloitte, a financial litigator at Bingham McCutchen, and advertising policy strategist at Google, Catherine recently founded a legal analytics startup. She holds a J.D. from New York University School of Law, a B.B.A. and an M.P.A. in business and accounting from the University of Texas at Austin. Her certifications include New York State Bar admission, C.P.A. license and Certified Information Privacy Professional.
fields.name: Catherine Hammack
fields.title: CFO, Board Member

fields._bio_rendered: Jeffrey Elman is Distinguished Professor of Cognitive Science and Dean of Social Sciences at the University of California, San Diego. He is a well-known psycholinguist and pioneer in the field of neural networks. In recent years, he has been helping to coordinate UC San Diego's online education strategy and partnerships.
fields.bio: Jeffrey Elman is Distinguished Professor of Cognitive Science and Dean of Social Sciences at the University of California, San Diego. He is a well-known psycholinguist and pioneer in the field of neural networks. In recent years, he has been helping to coordinate UC San Diego's online education strategy and partnerships.
fields.name: Jeffrey Elman
fields.title: Board Member

fields._bio_rendered: Bilal spends his time overcoming the knowledge and digital divide across languages. He is Dean of Translations at Khan Academy and has previously worked for an international network of private schools, an early stage venture firm and an actuarial consulting company. Bilal has an MBA and MA in education from Stanford University and a BS in Actuarial Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
fields.bio: Bilal spends his time overcoming the knowledge and digital divide across languages. He is Dean of Translations at Khan Academy and has previously worked for an international network of private schools, an early stage venture firm and an actuarial consulting company. Bilal has an MBA and MA in education from Stanford University and a BS in Actuarial Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
fields.name: Bilal Musharraf
fields.title: Board Member

fields._bio_rendered: Sarah Loos is a Ph.D. student in the Computer Science Department at Carnegie Mellon University and a Department of Energy Computational Science Graduate Fellow. In addition to serving on the board of FLE, Sarah is a board trustee for the Anita Borg Institute for Women and Technology and she serves on the ACM-W Council.
fields.bio: Sarah Loos is a Ph.D. student in the Computer Science Department at Carnegie Mellon University and a Department of Energy Computational Science Graduate Fellow. In addition to serving on the board of FLE, Sarah is a board trustee for the Anita Borg Institute for Women and Technology and she serves on the ACM-W Council.
fields.name: Sarah Karnowski
fields.title: Board Member

fields._bio_rendered: Marshall "Mike" S. Smith is retired and a Visiting Resident Scholar at the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching and a Visiting Scholar in Education at Harvard. His most recent full time assignment was as the Senior Counselor to U.S. Secretary of Education, Arne Duncan, and Director, Office of International Affairs, U.S. Department of Education. Earlier Dr. Smith was the Program Director for Education at The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation.

fields.name: Marshall "Mike" Smith
fields.title: Board Member

fields._description_rendered:
Responsibilities include:
  • Designing print media for distribution to our deploying partners, funders, and individual donors
  • Complete license to work with front-end development team to redesign anything user facing including, but not limited to: http://learningequality.org/, http://kalite.learningequality.org/ , and the KA Lite app itself!
Experience with the following preferred:
  • Photoshop or GIMP
  • Illustrator or Inkscape
  • User experience and visual design principles
To apply, you’ll need:
  • A brief cover letter (300 words or less on why you’d like to work with us)
  • A link to your resume or LinkedIn
  • A link to your online portfolio (alternatively, some attachments of past work)
  • A list of 3 things you’d improve about either http://learningequality.org/ or http://kalite.learningequality.org/

fields.title: Design Intern

fields._description_rendered:
Responsibilities include:
  • Designing and implementing your own features and/or fixes to GitHub issues
  • Coordinating with our dev team to build the open-source community
  • Reviewing code for style and quality
Experience with the following preferred:
  • Python
  • Django
  • Javascript, jQuery
  • Git
  • User experience and visual design principles.
To apply, you’ll need:
  • A brief cover letter (300 words or less on why you’d like to work with us)
  • A link to your resume or LinkedIn
  • A link to any live projects, past projects, and your GitHub account or online portfolio

fields._description_rendered:
Responsibilities include:
  • Communicating with deploying partners and users via email and Skype
  • Researching, recording, and organizing current deployments
  • Synthesizing qualitative feedback into meaningful recommendations for future direction
Experience with the following preferred:
  • Being awesome and personable
  • Excellent communication and organization skills
  • Google Spreadsheets
  • Qualitative and quantitative research design
To apply, you’ll need:
  • A brief cover letter (500 words or less on why you’d like to work with us)
  • A link to your resume or LinkedIn

fields._description_rendered:
Responsibilities include:
  • Designing and/or implementing redesigns of all user-facing interfaces including, but not limited to: http://learningequality.org, http://kalite.learningequality.org, and KA Lite itself!
  • Optimizing all of the above for mobile!
Experience with the following preferred:
  • HTML
  • CSS & LESS
  • Javascript, jQuery (enough to work with popular plugins and frameworks)
  • User experience and visual design principles.
To apply, you’ll need:
  • A brief cover letter (300 words or less on why you’d like to work with us)
  • A link to your resume or LinkedIn
  • A link to any live projects, past projects, and your GitHub account or online portfolio
  • Open at least 3 issues on GitHub for UX enhancements or front-end tweaks to either of the following websites:
    • http://learningequality.org/ (GitHub repo: https://github.com/fle-internal/fle-site)
    • http://kalite.learningequality.org/ (GitHub repo: https://github.com/learningequality/ka-lite)
